Key Match Events: Andrew Heaney received five runs of support from the Rangers' offense, which eclipsed his run support total from his last seven starts combined.
The Rangers scored five runs in the first two innings, chasing Angels starter Caden Dana out of the game with no outs in the second inning.
Texas pulled out a 7-4 win over the Angels to complete a series win at Globe Life Field.
Marcus Semien had a pair of RBIs in the win.
Pre-Game Insights: Entering Sunday’s matchup with the Angels, Andrew Heaney had received two-or-fewer runs of support in seven straight starts and in 18 of his 27 starts.
Heaney’s team-low 3.55 run support average was the fifth-lowest mark in the American League (min. 130 IP).
Post-Match Reflections: Andrew Heaney expressed happiness about the early run support from his team.
Heaney mentioned that the team is playing more loose and free over the past few weeks.
Marcus Semien praised Heaney's performance despite his record.
Manager Bruce Bochy praised Heaney for his consistency and being able to make his starts.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rangers have now won four straight series, prevailing over the White Sox, A's, Yankees, and Angels.
Texas is 10-3 since Aug. 28, marking the club's best 13-game stretch since Aug. 3-16, 2023 (also 10-3).
